types.name: BulkOperation
types.description:
An asynchronous long-running operation to fetch data in bulk.

Bulk operations are created using the `bulkOperationRunQuery` mutation. After they are created,
clients should poll the `status` field for updates. When `COMPLETED`, the `url` field contains
a link to the data in [JSONL](http://jsonlines.org/) format.

See the [bulk operations guide](https://help.shopify.com/api/guides/bulk-operations) for more details.

fields.name: completedAt
fields.description: When the bulk operation was successfully completed.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: When the bulk operation was created.

fields.name: errorCode
fields.description: Error code for failed operations.

fields.name: fileSize
fields.description: File size in bytes of the file in the `url` field.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Globally unique identifier.

fields.name: objectCount
fields.description:
The running count of all objects processed.
For example, when fetching all products and their variants, this field counts both products and variants.
This field can be used to track operation progress.

fields.name: partialDataUrl
fields.description:
URL to partial/incomplete response data (in [JSONL](http://jsonlines.org/) format) returned by a failed operation.
Expires **one week** after the operation fails. Returns `null` when there's no data available.

fields.name: query
fields.description: GraphQL query document specified in `bulkOperationRunQuery`.

fields.name: rootObjectCount
fields.description:
The running count of all objects processed at the root of the query.
For example, when fetching all products and their variants, this field counts only products.
This field can be used to track operation progress.

fields.name: status
fields.description: Status of the bulk operation.

fields.name: url
fields.description:
URL to the response data in [JSONL](http://jsonlines.org/) format.
Expires **one week** after the operation completes.

enumValues.name: ACCESS_DENIED
enumValues.description:
The provided operation `query` returned access denied due to missing
[access scopes](https://help.shopify.com/api/getting-started/authentication/oauth/scopes).
Review the requested object permissions and execute the query as a normal non-bulk GraphQL request to see more details.

enumValues.name: INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR
enumValues.description: Operation resulted in partial or incomplete data due to internal server errors during execution.

enumValues.name: TIMEOUT
enumValues.description:
Operation resulted in partial or incomplete data due to query timeouts during execution.
In some cases, timeouts can be avoided by modifying your `query` to select fewer fields.

types.name: CollectionRule
types.description: Represents at rule that's used to assign products to a collection.

fields.name: column
fields.description: The attribute that the rule focuses on (for example, `title` or `product_type`).

fields.description: The value that the operator is applied to (for example, `Hats`).

fields.description: The type of operator that the rule is based on (for example, `equals`, `contains`, or `not_equals`).

types.description: Collections may use rules to automatically include the matching products. This defines restrictions for a type of rule.

fields.description: Most commonly used relation for this rule.

fields.name: ruleType

types.name: CollectionRuleInput
types.description: Specifies a rule to associate with a collection.

inputFields.name: column
inputFields.description: The attribute that the rule focuses on (for example, `title` or `product_type`).

inputFields.name: relation
inputFields.description: The type of operator that the rule is based on (for example, `equals`, `contains`, or `not_equals`).

inputFields.name: condition
inputFields.description: The value that the operator is applied to (for example, `Hats`).

types.name: CollectionRuleRelation
types.description: Specifies the relationship between the `column` and the condition.

enumValues.name: ENDS_WITH
enumValues.description: The attribute ends with the condition.

enumValues.name: EQUALS
enumValues.description: The attribute is equal to the condition.

enumValues.name: GREATER_THAN
enumValues.description: The attribute is greater than the condition.

enumValues.name: LESS_THAN
enumValues.description: The attribute is less than the condition.

enumValues.name: NOT_CONTAINS
enumValues.description: The attribute does not contain the condition.

enumValues.name: NOT_EQUALS
enumValues.description: The attribute does not equal the condition.

enumValues.name: STARTS_WITH
enumValues.description: The attribute starts with the condition.

types.name: CollectionRuleSet

fields.name: appliedDisjunctively
fields.description:
Whether products must match any or all of the rules to be included in the collection.
If true, then products must match one or more of the rules to be included in the collection.
If false, then products must match all of the rules to be included in the collection.

types.name: Customer
types.description:
Represents information about a customer of the shop, such as the customer's contact details, their order
history, and whether they've agreed to receive email marketing.

fields.description:
Whether the merchant can delete the customer from their store.

A customer can be deleted from a store only if they have not yet made an order. After a customer makes an
order, they can't be deleted from a store.

fields.description: The date and time when the customer was added to the store.

fields.description: The default address associated with the customer.

fields.description:
The full name of the customer, based on the values for first_name and last_name. If the first_name and
last_name are not available, then this falls back to the customer's email address, and if that is not available, the customer's phone number.

A comma separated list of tags associated with the customer. Updating `tags` overwrites
any existing tags that were previously added to the customer. To add new tags without overwriting
existing tags, use the [tagsAdd](https://shopify.dev/docs/admin-api/graphql/reference/common-objects/tagsadd)
mutation.

inputFields.name: taxExempt
inputFields.description: Whether the customer is exempt from paying taxes on their order.

inputFields.name: taxExemptions
inputFields.description: The list of tax exemptions to apply to the customer.

types.name: CustomerJourney
types.description: Represents a customer's activity on a shop's online store.

fields.name: customerOrderIndex
fields.description: The position of the current order within the customer's order history.

fields.name: daysToConversion
fields.description: The amount of days between first session and order creation date. First session represents first session since the last order, or first session within the 30 day attribution window, if more than 30 days has passed since the last order.

fields.name: firstVisit
fields.description: The customer's first session going into the shop.

fields.name: lastVisit
fields.description: The last session before an order is made.

fields.name: moments
fields.description: Events preceding a customer order, such as shop sessions.

fields.name: lastVisit

types.name: CustomerMarketingOptInLevel
types.description:
The valid values for the marketing subscription opt-in active at the time the customer consented to email
marketing.

The levels are defined by [the M3AAWG best practices guideline
  document](https://www.m3aawg.org/sites/maawg/files/news/M3AAWG_Senders_BCP_Ver3-2015-02.pdf).

enumValues.name: SINGLE_OPT_IN
enumValues.description:
The customer started receiving marketing email(s) after providing their email address, without any
intermediate steps.

enumValues.name: CONFIRMED_OPT_IN
enumValues.description:
After providing their email address, the customer received a confirmation email which required them to
perform a prescribed action before receiving marketing emails.

enumValues.name: UNKNOWN
enumValues.description: The customer receives marketing emails, but the original opt-in process is unknown.

types.name: CustomerProductSubscriberStatus
types.description: Possible subscriber states of a customer defined by their subscription contracts.

enumValues.name: ACTIVE
enumValues.description: The customer has at least one active subscription contract.

enumValues.name: CANCELLED
enumValues.description:
The customer's last subscription contract was cancelled and there are no other active or paused
subscription contracts.

enumValues.name: EXPIRED
enumValues.description:
The customer's last subscription contract expired and there are no other active or paused
subscription contracts.

enumValues.name: FAILED
enumValues.description:
The customer's last subscription contract failed and there are no other active or paused
subscription contracts.

enumValues.name: NEVER_SUBSCRIBED
enumValues.description: The customer has never had a subscription contract.

enumValues.name: PAUSED
enumValues.description:
The customer has at least one paused subscription contract and there are no other active
subscription contracts.

enumValues.description: The customer declined the email invite to create an account.

enumValues.name: DISABLED
enumValues.description: The customer doesn't have an active account. Customer accounts can be disabled from the Shopify admin at any time.

types.name: CustomerVisit
types.description: Information about a customer's session on a shop's online store.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Globally unique identifier.

fields.name: landingPage
fields.description: URL of the first page the customer landed on for the session.

fields.name: landingPageHtml
fields.description: Landing page information with URL linked in HTML. For example, the first page the customer visited was store.myshopify.com/products/1.

fields.name: marketingEvent
fields.description:
Represent actions taken by an app, on behalf of a merchant,
to market Shopify resources such as products, collections, and discounts.

fields.name: occurredAt
fields.description: When the customer moment occurred.

fields.name: referralCode
fields.description:
Marketing referral code from the link that the customer clicked to visit the store.
Supports the following URL attributes: _ref_, _source_, or _r_.
For example, if the URL is myshopifystore.com/products/slide?ref=j2tj1tn2, then this value is j2tj1tn2.

fields.name: referralInfoHtml
fields.description: Referral information with URLs linked in HTML.

fields.name: referrerUrl
fields.description:
Webpage where the customer clicked a link that sent them to the online store.
For example, _https://randomblog.com/page1_ or _android-app://com.google.android.gm_.

fields.name: source
fields.description:
Source from which the customer visited the store, such as a platform (Facebook, Google), email, direct,
a website domain, QR code, or unknown.

fields.name: sourceDescription
fields.description: Describes the source explicitly for first or last session.

fields.name: sourceType
fields.description: Type of marketing tactic.

fields.name: utmParameters
fields.description: A set of UTM parameters gathered from the URL parameters of the referrer.

types.name: Date
types.description: An [ISO-8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) encoded UTC date string. Example value: `"2019-07-16"`.

types.name: DateTime
types.description: An ISO-8601 encoded UTC date time string. Example value: `"2019-07-03T20:47:55Z"`.

types.name: DayOfTheWeek
types.description: Days of the week from Monday to Sunday.

types.name: Decimal
types.description: A signed decimal number, which supports arbitrary precision and is serialized as a string. Example value: `"29.99"`.

types.name: DeletionEvent
types.description:
Deletion events chronicle the destruction of resources (e.g. products and collections).
Once deleted, the deletion event is the only trace of the original's existence,
as the resource itself has been removed and can no longer be accessed.

fields.name: occurredAt
fields.description: The date and time when the deletion event for the related resource was generated.

fields.name: subjectId
fields.description: The id of the resource that was deleted.

fields.name: subjectType
fields.description: The type of resource that was deleted.

types.name: DiscountApplicationAllocationMethod
types.description: The method by which the discount's value is allocated onto its entitled lines.

enumValues.name: ACROSS
enumValues.description: The value is spread across all entitled lines.

enumValues.name: EACH
enumValues.description: The value is applied onto every entitled line.

enumValues.name: ONE
enumValues.description: The value is specifically applied onto a particular line.

types.name: DiscountApplicationLevel
types.description: The method by which the discount's value is allocated onto its entitled lines.

enumValues.name: ORDER
enumValues.description:
The discount was applied at the order level.
Order level discounts are not factored into the discountedUnitPriceSet on line items.

enumValues.name: LINE
enumValues.description:
The discount was applied at the line level.
Line level discounts are factored into the discountedUnitPriceSet on line items.

types.name: DiscountApplicationTargetSelection
types.description:
Which lines on the order that the discount is allocated over, of the type
defined by the Discount Application's target_type.

enumValues.name: ALL
enumValues.description: The discount is allocated onto all the lines.

enumValues.name: ENTITLED
enumValues.description: The discount is allocated onto only the lines it is entitled for.

enumValues.name: EXPLICIT
enumValues.description: The discount is allocated onto explicitly chosen lines.

types.name: DiscountApplicationTargetType
types.description: The type of line (i.e. line item or shipping line) on an order that the discount is applicable towards.

enumValues.name: LINE_ITEM
enumValues.description: The discount applies onto line items.

enumValues.name: SHIPPING_LINE
enumValues.description: The discount applies onto shipping lines.

existing tags, use the [tagsAdd](https://shopify.dev/docs/admin-api/graphql/reference/common-objects/tagsadd)

types.name: DraftOrderInput
types.description: The input fields used to create or update a draft order.

inputFields.name: appliedDiscount
inputFields.description:
The discount that will be applied to the draft order.
A draft order line item can have one discount. A draft order can also have one order-level discount.

inputFields.name: billingAddress
inputFields.description: The mailing address associated with the payment method.

inputFields.name: customerId
inputFields.description: Customer associated with the draft order.

inputFields.name: customAttributes
inputFields.description: Extra information added to the customer.

inputFields.name: email
inputFields.description: The customer's email address.

inputFields.name: lineItems
inputFields.description:
Product variant line item or custom line item associated to the draft order.
Each draft order must include at least one line item.

inputFields.name: metafields
inputFields.description: Metafields attached to the draft order.

inputFields.name: privateMetafields
inputFields.description: The private metafields attached to the draft order.

inputFields.name: localizationExtensions
inputFields.description: The localization extensions attached to the draft order. For example, Tax IDs.

inputFields.name: note
inputFields.description: The text of an optional note that a shop owner can attach to the draft order.

inputFields.name: shippingAddress
inputFields.description: The mailing address to where the order will be shipped.

inputFields.name: shippingLine
inputFields.description: A shipping line object, which details the shipping method used.

inputFields.name: tags
inputFields.description: A comma separated list of tags that have been added to the draft order.

inputFields.name: taxExempt
inputFields.description:
Whether or not taxes are exempt for the draft order.
If false, then Shopify will refer to the taxable field for each line item.
If a customer is applied to the draft order, then Shopify will use the customer's tax exempt field instead.

inputFields.name: useCustomerDefaultAddress
inputFields.description: Sent as part of a draft order object to load customer shipping information.

types.name: DraftOrderLineItem
types.description: Represents a line item included in a draft order.

fields.name: appliedDiscount
fields.description: Discount which will be applied to the line item or the overall order.

fields.name: custom
fields.description:
Whether this is a product variant line item, or a custom line item.
If set to true indicates a custom line item. If set to false indicates a product variant line item.

fields.name: customAttributes
fields.description: List of additional information (metafields) about the line item.

fields.name: discountedTotal
fields.description: Line item price after discounts are applied.

fields.name: discountedUnitPrice
fields.description: The `discountedTotal` divided by `quantity`, resulting in the value of the discount per unit.

fields.name: fulfillmentService
fields.description:
Name of the service provider who fulfilled the order.

Valid values are either **manual** or the name of the provider.
For example, **amazon**, **shipwire**.

fields.name: grams
fields.description: Weight in grams. Can only be specified if this is a custom line item.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Globally unique identifier.

fields.name: image
fields.description: Image associated with the draft order line item.

args.name: maxWidth
args.description: Image width in pixels between 1 and 2048. This argument is deprecated: Use `maxWidth` on `Image.transformedSrc` instead.

args.name: maxHeight
args.description: Image height in pixels between 1 and 2048. This argument is deprecated: Use `maxHeight` on `Image.transformedSrc` instead.

args.name: crop
args.description: Crops the image according to the specified region. This argument is deprecated: Use `crop` on `Image.transformedSrc` instead.

args.name: scale
args.description: Image size multiplier for high-resolution retina displays. Must be between 1 and 3. This argument is deprecated: Use `scale` on `Image.transformedSrc` instead.

fields.name: isGiftCard
fields.description: Whether the line item represents the puchase of a gift card.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of the product.

fields.name: originalTotal
fields.description: Total price (without discounts) of the line item, based on the original unit price of the variant x quantity.

fields.name: originalUnitPrice
fields.description: Variant price without any discounts applied.

fields.name: product
fields.description: The product corresponding to the line item’s product variant.

fields.name: quantity
fields.description: Number of variant items requested in the draft order.

fields.name: requiresShipping
fields.description: Whether physical shipping is required for the variant.

fields.name: sku
fields.description: Variant SKU number.

fields.name: taxLines
fields.description: A list of tax line objects, each of which details the total taxes applicable to the order.

fields.name: taxable
fields.description: Whether the variant is taxable.

fields.name: title
fields.description: Title of the product or variant (this field only applies to custom line items).

fields.name: totalDiscount
fields.description: Total value of the discount applied to the line item.

fields.name: variant
fields.description: Associated variant for the line item.

fields.name: variantTitle
fields.description: Name of the variant.

fields.name: vendor
fields.description: Name of the vendor who made the variant.

fields.name: weight
fields.description: Weight unit and value for a draft order line item.

types.name: FulfillmentOrder
types.description:
Represents a fulfillment order. In Shopify, a fulfillment order represents a group of one or more items
in an order that are to be fulfilled from the same location. There can be more than one fulfillment order
for an order at a given location.

fields.description: The fulfillment order's assigned location. This is the location expected to perform fulfillment.

fields.name: deliveryMethod
fields.description: Delivery method of this fulfillment order.

fields.name: destination
fields.description: The destination where the items should be sent.

fields.name: fulfillAt
fields.description: The date and time at which the fulfillment order will be fulfillable.

fields.name: fulfillments

types.name: FulfillmentOrderAction
types.description: The actions that can be taken on a fulfillment order.

enumValues.name: CREATE_FULFILLMENT
enumValues.description: Create a fulfillment for selected line items in the fulfillment order. The corresponding mutation for this action is FulfillmentCreateV2.

enumValues.name: REQUEST_FULFILLMENT
enumValues.description: Send a request for fulfilling selected line items in a fulfillment order to a fulfillment service. The corresponding mutation for this action is FulfillmentOrderSubmitFulfillmentRequest.

enumValues.name: CANCEL_FULFILLMENT_ORDER
enumValues.description: Cancel a fulfillment order. The corresponding mutation for this action is FulfillmentOrderCancel.

enumValues.name: MOVE
enumValues.description: Move a fulfillment order. The corresponding mutation for this action is FulfillmentOrderMove.

enumValues.name: REQUEST_CANCELLATION
enumValues.description: Send a cancellation request to the fulfillment service of a fulfillment order. The corresponding mutation for this action is FulfillmentOrderSubmitCancellationRequest.

enumValues.name: MARK_AS_OPEN
enumValues.description: Mark the fulfillment order as open.

enumValues.name: EXTERNAL
enumValues.description: Open an external URL to initiate the fulfillment process outside Shopify.

types.name: FulfillmentOrderAssignedLocation
types.description:
Represents the assigned location of a fulfillment order, which is a snapshot of the location
at which the fulfillment order was created. The assigned location is expected to perform fulfillment.

fields.name: address1
fields.description: The first line of the address for the location.

fields.name: address2
fields.description: The second line of the address for the location.

fields.name: city
fields.description: The city of the location.

fields.name: countryCode
fields.description: The two-letter country code of the location.

fields.name: location
fields.description:
The location where the fulfillment order was created. This can differ from the
`FulfillmentOrderAssignedLocation` if the location was updated since the fulfillment order
was closed.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the location.

fields.name: phone
fields.description: The phone number of the location.

fields.name: province
fields.description: The province of the location.

fields.name: zip
fields.description: The ZIP code of the location.

types.description: The assigment status to be used to filter fulfillment orders.

enumValues.name: CANCELLATION_REQUESTED
enumValues.description:
Fulfillment orders for which the merchant has requested cancellation of
the previously accepted fulfillment request.

enumValues.name: FULFILLMENT_REQUESTED
enumValues.description: Fulfillment orders for which the merchant has requested fulfillment.

enumValues.name: FULFILLMENT_ACCEPTED
enumValues.description:
Fulfillment orders for which the merchant's fulfillment request has been accepted.
Any number of fulfillments can be created on these fulfillment orders
to completely fulfill the requested items.

types.name: FulfillmentOrderRequestStatus
types.description: The request status of a fulfillment order.

enumValues.name: UNSUBMITTED
enumValues.description:
The initial request status for the newly created fulfillment orders. This is the only valid
request status for fulfillment orders that aren't assigned to a fulfillment service.

enumValues.name: SUBMITTED
enumValues.description: The merchant requested fulfillment for this fulfillment order.

enumValues.name: ACCEPTED
enumValues.description: The fulfillment service accepted the merchant's fulfillment request.

enumValues.name: REJECTED
enumValues.description: The fulfillment service rejected the merchant's fulfillment request.

enumValues.name: CANCELLATION_REQUESTED
enumValues.description: The merchant requested a cancellation of the fulfillment request for this fulfillment order.

enumValues.name: CANCELLATION_ACCEPTED
enumValues.description: The fulfillment service accepted the merchant's fulfillment cancellation request.

enumValues.name: CANCELLATION_REJECTED
enumValues.description: The fulfillment service rejected the merchant's fulfillment cancellation request.

enumValues.name: CLOSED
enumValues.description: The fulfillment service closed the fulfillment order without completing it.

fulfillment order line items are left blank then all the fulfillment order line items of the
associated fulfillment order ID will be fulfilled.

types.name: ID
types.description:
Represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache.
The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String, but it is not intended to be human-readable.
When expected as an input type, any string (such as "4") or integer (such as 4) input value will be accepted as an ID.

Admin API example value: `"gid://shopify/Product/10079785100"`.

Storefront API example value: `"Z2lkOi8vc2hvcGlmeS9Qcm9kdWN0LzEwMDc5Nzg1MTAw"`.

types.name: MarketingActivityStatus
types.description: Status helps to identify if this marketing activity has been completed, queued, failed etc.

enumValues.name: ACTIVE
enumValues.description: This marketing activity is currently running.

enumValues.name: DELETED
enumValues.description: This marketing activity is permanently unavailable.

enumValues.name: DELETED_EXTERNALLY
enumValues.description: This marketing activity was deleted and it was triggered from outside of Shopify.

enumValues.name: DISCONNECTED
enumValues.description: This marketing activity is disconnected and no longer editable.

enumValues.name: DRAFT
enumValues.description: This marketing activity is started but not yet created.

enumValues.name: FAILED
enumValues.description: This marketing activity is unable to run.

enumValues.name: INACTIVE
enumValues.description: This marketing activity has completed running.

enumValues.name: PAUSED
enumValues.description: This marketing activity is currently not running.

enumValues.name: PENDING
enumValues.description: This marketing activity is pending creation on the app's platform.

enumValues.name: SCHEDULED
enumValues.description: This marketing activity is scheduled to run.

enumValues.name: UNDEFINED
enumValues.description: There is no defined status for external marketing activities.

enumValues.name: ATTENTION
enumValues.description: This status badge has type attention.

enumValues.name: WARNING

enumValues.description: This status badge has type info.

provide a consistent representation for any given piece of marketing
regardless of the app that created it.

fields.description: The referrer of the marketing event. Example values: `google`, `newsletter`.

inputFields.description: Currency of the money.

types.name: MoneyV2
types.description:
A monetary value with currency.

To format currencies, combine this type's amount and currencyCode fields with your client's locale.

For example, in JavaScript you could use Intl.NumberFormat:

```js
new Intl.NumberFormat(locale, {
  style: 'currency',
  currency: currencyCode
}).format(amount);
```

Other formatting libraries include:

* iOS - [NumberFormatter](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/foundation/numberformatter)
* Android - [NumberFormat](https://developer.android.com/reference/java/text/NumberFormat.html)
* PHP - [NumberFormatter](http://php.net/manual/en/class.numberformatter.php)

For a more general solution, the [Unicode CLDR number formatting database] is available with many implementations
(such as [TwitterCldr](https://github.com/twitter/twitter-cldr-rb)).

fields.name: amount
fields.description: Decimal money amount.

fields.name: currencyCode
fields.description: Currency of the money.

types.name: Order
types.description: An order represents an agreement to do business between a customer and a merchant.

fields.name: alerts
fields.description:
Generated messages that appear at the top of an order page in the Shopify admin.
For example, _this is a test order_.

fields.name: billingAddress
fields.description:
Mailing address provided by the customer.
Not all orders have mailing addresses.

fields.name: billingAddressMatchesShippingAddress
fields.description: Whether the billing address matches the shipping address.

fields.name: canMarkAsPaid
fields.description: Whether the order can be manually marked as paid.

fields.name: canNotifyCustomer
fields.description: Whether notifications can be sent to the customer or not.

fields.name: cancelReason
fields.description:
Reason the order was canceled.
Returns null if the order wasn't canceled.

fields.name: cancelledAt
fields.description:
Date and time when the order was canceled.
Returns null if the order wasn't canceled.

fields.name: capturable
fields.description:
Whether payment for the order can be captured.
Returns true when the customer's credit card has been authorized for payment and the authorization period has not expired.

fields.name: cartDiscountAmount
fields.description: Amount of the order-level discount (does not contain any line item discounts).

fields.name: cartDiscountAmountSet
fields.description: Amount of the order-level discount (does not contain any line item discounts) in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: channel
fields.description: Channel that created the order.

fields.name: clientIp
fields.description: The ip address of the client that is associated with this order.

fields.name: closed
fields.description: Whether the order is closed.

fields.name: closedAt
fields.description:
Date and time when the order closed.
If the order is not closed, then this field is null.

fields.name: confirmed
fields.description: Whether inventory has been reserved for the order.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: Date and time when the order was created in Shopify.

fields.name: currencyCode
fields.description:
The currency of the store at the time of the order.
If payment hasn't occurred, then this field is null.

fields.name: currentCartDiscountAmountSet
fields.description: The amount of the order-level discount minus the amounts for line items that have been returned. This doesn't include line item discounts.

fields.name: currentSubtotalLineItemsQuantity
fields.description: The sum of the quantities for the line items that contribute to the order's subtotal.

fields.name: currentSubtotalPriceSet
fields.description: The subtotal of line items and their discounts minus the line items that have been returned. This includes order-level discounts, unless the argument with_cart_discount is set to false. This doesn't include shipping costs and shipping discounts. Taxes are not included unless the order is a taxes-included order.

fields.name: currentTaxLines
fields.description: The taxes charged for the order minus the taxes for line items that have been returned.

fields.name: currentTotalDiscountsSet
fields.description: The total amount discounted from the order (including order-level and line item discounts) minus the amounts for items that have been returned.

fields.name: currentTotalDutiesSet
fields.description: The total amount of duties for the order. If duties aren't applicable, then this value is `null`.

fields.name: currentTotalPriceSet
fields.description: The total amount of the order (including taxes and discounts) minus the amounts for line items that have been returned.

fields.name: currentTotalTaxSet
fields.description: The total of all taxes applied to the order minus the taxes for line items that have been returned.

fields.name: currentTotalWeight
fields.description: The total weight (grams) of the order minus the weights for line items that have been returned.

fields.name: customAttributes
fields.description:
Custom information added to the order by your customer
(Also referred to as note attributes).

fields.name: customer
fields.description:
Unique identifier of the customer who placed the order.
Not all orders have customers associated with them.

fields.name: customerAcceptsMarketing
fields.description: Whether the customer agreed to receive marketing materials.

fields.name: customerJourney
fields.description: Description of the customer's experience with the store leading up to the order.

fields.name: customerJourneySummary
fields.description:
Description of the customer's experience with the store leading up to the order.
Loaded asynchronously, consumers should poll until the 'ready' field resolves to true.

fields.name: customerLocale
fields.description:
A two-letter or three-letter language code, optionally followed by a region modifier.
Example values could be 'en', 'en-CA', 'en-PIRATE'.

fields.name: discountApplications
fields.description: Discounts that have been applied on the order.

fields.name: displayFinancialStatus
fields.description:
Financial status of the order that can be shown to the merchant.
This field does not capture all the possible details of an order's financial state and should only be used for display summary purposes.

fields.name: displayFulfillmentStatus
fields.description:
Fulfillment status for the order that can be shown to the merchant.
This field does not capture all the possible details of an order's fulfillment state. It should only be used for display summary purposes.

fields.name: disputes
fields.description: Summary of each dispute associated with the order. Sorted in ascending (ASC) order by ID.

fields.name: draftFulfillments
fields.description: List of possible fulfilments that can be made for the order (includes line items that can be partially fulfilled).

fields.name: edited
fields.description: Whether the order has had any edits applied or not.

fields.name: email
fields.description: Email address provided by the customer.

fields.name: events

This value is not unique across multiple stores.

For example, because some or all of the items have been refunded, or the item is not one which can be fulfilled, such as a tip.
These line items would be 'lost' if you only considered the line items in draft fulfillments or fulfillments.

When orders are imported from an app, this date and time may not match the date and time when the order was created.

fields.name: publication

fields.name: referralCode
fields.description:
Marketing referral code from the link that the customer clicked to visit your store.
Supports the following URL attributes: _ref_, _source_, or _r_. For example, if the URL is myshopifystore.com/products/slide?ref=j2tj1tn2, then this value is j2tj1tn2.

fields.name: referrerDisplayText
fields.description: Website that sent the customer to your online store.

fields.name: referrerUrl
fields.description:
Webpage where the customer clicked a link that sent them to your online store.
For example, _Google_ or _randomblog.com/page1_.

fields.name: refundDiscrepancySet
fields.description: The difference between suggested and actual refund amounts.  A positive value indicates a difference in the merchants favor and a negative value indicates a difference in the customers favor.

fields.name: refundable
fields.description: Whether the order can be refunded.

fields.name: refunds
fields.description: List of refunds that have been applied to the order.

If `true`, the suggested refund will be formed from all refundable line items and will
ignore any passed in `refundLineItems`.

any existing tags that were previously added to the order. To add new tags without overwriting
existing tags, use the [tagsAdd](https://shopify.dev/docs/admin-api/graphql/reference/common-objects/tagsadd)
mutation.

args.name: first
args.description: Truncate the array result to this size.

args.name: capturable
args.description:
Filter transactions by whether they are capturable.
If true, then returns only transactions that represent an authorized payment that can be captured.
If false, then returns all transactions.

args.name: manuallyResolvable
args.description:
Filter transactions by whether they are manual payments.
If true, then returns only transactions that are manual payments. If false, then returns all transactions.

fields.name: unpaid
fields.description:
Whether no payments have been made for the order.
If no payments have been made for the order, then this returns true.

The level can be set by Shopify risk analysis or by an app.

enumValues.name: MEDIUM

enumValues.name: HIGH

results by relevance to the search term(s). When no search query is specified, this sort key is not
deterministic and should not be used.

types.name: OrderTransaction
types.description: A transaction represents an exchange of money as part of an order.

fields.name: accountNumber

fields.description: The amount of money.

fields.description: The amount and currency of the transaction.

fields.description: Authorization code associated with the transaction.

fields.description: The time when the authorization expires. This field is available only to stores on a Shopify Plus plan and is populated only for Shopify Payments authorizations.

fields.description: Date and time when the transaction was created.

fields.name: errorCode
fields.description: A standardized error code, independent of the payment provider.

fields.name: fees
fields.description: The transaction fees charged on the order transaction.

fields.name: formattedGateway
fields.description: The human-readable payment gateway name used to process the transaction.

fields.description: The payment gateway used to process the transaction.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Globally unique identifier.

fields.name: kind
fields.description: The kind of transaction.

fields.name: manuallyCapturable

fields.description: Specifies the available amount to refund on the gateway. Only available within SuggestedRefund.

fields.name: maximumRefundableV2
fields.description:
Specifies the available amount with currency to refund on the gateway.
Only available within SuggestedRefund.

fields.name: order

fields.name: paymentIcon

args.name: maxWidth
args.description: Image width in pixels between 1 and 2048. This argument is deprecated: Use `maxWidth` on `Image.transformedSrc` instead.

args.name: maxHeight
args.description: Image height in pixels between 1 and 2048. This argument is deprecated: Use `maxHeight` on `Image.transformedSrc` instead.

args.name: crop
args.description: Crops the image according to the specified region. This argument is deprecated: Use `crop` on `Image.transformedSrc` instead.

args.name: scale
args.description: Image size multiplier for high-resolution retina displays. Must be between 1 and 3. This argument is deprecated: Use `scale` on `Image.transformedSrc` instead.

fields.name: paymentMethod
fields.description: Specifies the credit card company used to pay for this transaction.

fields.name: processedAt
fields.description: Date and time when the transaction was processed.

fields.name: receipt
fields.description:
A transaction receipt attached to the transaction by the gateway.
The value of this field depends on which gateway processed the transaction.

fields.name: settlementCurrency
fields.description: The settlement currency.

fields.name: settlementCurrencyRate
fields.description: The rate used when converting the transaction amount to settlement currency.

fields.name: shopifyPaymentsSet
fields.description: Contains all Shopify Payments information related to an order transaction. This field is available only to stores on a Shopify Plus plan.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The status of this transaction.

fields.name: test
fields.description: Whether the transaction is a test transaction.

fields.name: totalUnsettled
fields.description:
Specifies the available amount to capture on the gateway.
Only available when an amount is capturable or manually mark as paid.

fields.name: totalUnsettledSet
fields.description:
Specifies the available amount with currency to capture on the gateway in shop and presentment currencies.
Only available when an amount is capturable or manually mark as paid.

fields.name: totalUnsettledV2
fields.description:
Specifies the available amount with currency to capture on the gateway.
Only available when an amount is capturable or manually mark as paid.

types.name: OrderTransactionErrorCode
types.description: A standardized error code, independent of the payment provider.

enumValues.name: INVALID_NUMBER
enumValues.description: The format of the card number is incorrect.

enumValues.name: INVALID_EXPIRY_DATE
enumValues.description: The format of the expiry date is incorrect.

enumValues.name: INVALID_CVC
enumValues.description: The format of the CVC is incorrect.

enumValues.name: INCORRECT_CVC
enumValues.description: The CVC does not match the card number.

enumValues.name: INCORRECT_ZIP
enumValues.description: The ZIP or postal code does not match the card number.

enumValues.name: INCORRECT_ADDRESS
enumValues.description: The address does not match the card number.

enumValues.name: PROCESSING_ERROR
enumValues.description: There was an error while processing the payment.

enumValues.name: PICK_UP_CARD
enumValues.description: The card has been reported as lost or stolen, and the card issuer has requested that the merchant keep the card and call the number on the back.

enumValues.name: CONFIG_ERROR
enumValues.description: There is an error in the gateway or merchant configuration.

enumValues.name: TEST_MODE_LIVE_CARD
enumValues.description: A real card was used but the gateway was in test mode.

enumValues.name: UNSUPPORTED_FEATURE
enumValues.description: The gateway or merchant configuration doesn't support a feature, such as network tokenization.

enumValues.name: GENERIC_ERROR
enumValues.description: There was an unknown error with processing the payment.

enumValues.name: INVALID_COUNTRY
enumValues.description: The payment method is not available in the customer's country.

enumValues.name: INVALID_AMOUNT
enumValues.description: The amount is either too high or too low for the provider.

enumValues.name: PAYMENT_METHOD_UNAVAILABLE
enumValues.description: The payment method is momentarily unavailable.

enumValues.name: AMAZON_PAYMENTS_MAX_AMOUNT_CHARGED
enumValues.description: The maximum amount has been captured.

enumValues.name: AMAZON_PAYMENTS_MAX_AMOUNT_REFUNDED
enumValues.description: The maximum amount has been refunded.

enumValues.name: AMAZON_PAYMENTS_MAX_AUTHORIZATIONS_CAPTURED
enumValues.description: The maximum of 10 authorizations has been captured for an order.

enumValues.name: AMAZON_PAYMENTS_MAX_REFUNDS_PROCESSED
enumValues.description: The maximum of 10 refunds has been processed for an order.

enumValues.name: AMAZON_PAYMENTS_ORDER_REFERENCE_CANCELED
enumValues.description: The order was canceled, which canceled all open authorizations.

enumValues.name: AMAZON_PAYMENTS_STALE
enumValues.description: The order was not confirmed within three hours.

types.name: OrderTransactionInput
types.description: Specifies the information needed to create an order transaction.

inputFields.name: amount
inputFields.description: The amount of money for this transaction.

inputFields.name: gateway
inputFields.description: The payment gateway to use for this transaction.

inputFields.name: kind
inputFields.description: The kind of transaction.

inputFields.name: orderId
inputFields.description: The ID of the order associated with the transaction.

inputFields.name: parentId
inputFields.description: The ID of the optional parent transaction, for example the authorization of a capture.

types.name: OrderTransactionKind
types.description: The different kinds of order transactions.

enumValues.name: SALE
enumValues.description: An authorization and capture performed together in a single step.

enumValues.name: CAPTURE
enumValues.description: A transfer of the money that was reserved during the authorization stage.

enumValues.name: AUTHORIZATION
enumValues.description:
An amount reserved against the cardholder's funding source.
Money does not change hands until the authorization is captured.

enumValues.name: VOID
enumValues.description: A cancellation of a pending authorization or capture.

enumValues.name: REFUND
enumValues.description:
A partial or full return of captured funds to the cardholder.
A refund can happen only after a capture is processed.

enumValues.name: CHANGE
enumValues.description: Money returned to the customer when they have paid too much.

enumValues.name: EMV_AUTHORIZATION
enumValues.description: An authorization for a payment taken with an EMV credit card reader.

enumValues.name: SUGGESTED_REFUND
enumValues.description: A suggested refund transaction that can be used to create a refund.

types.name: OrderTransactionStatus
types.description: Transaction status' describe the status of a transaction.

enumValues.name: ERROR
enumValues.description: There was an error while processing the transaction.

types.name: PriceRuleErrorCode
types.description: Possible error codes that could be returned by a price rule mutation.

enumValues.name: EQUAL_TO
enumValues.description: Input value should be equal to allowed value.

enumValues.name: GREATER_THAN
enumValues.description: Input value should be greater than minimum allowed value.

enumValues.name: GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO
enumValues.description: Input value should be greater than or equal to minimum allowed value.

enumValues.name: LESS_THAN
enumValues.description: Input value should be less than maximum allowed value.

enumValues.name: LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO
enumValues.description: Input value should be less or equal to maximum allowed value.

enumValues.name: PRICE_RULE_ALLOCATION_LIMIT_ON_NON_BOGO
enumValues.description: Allocation limit can only be set on buy one get one type discounts.

enumValues.name: PRICE_RULE_ALLOCATION_LIMIT_IS_ZERO
enumValues.description: Allocation limit must be a non zero positive number.

enumValues.name: PRICE_RULE_EXCEEDED_MAX_DISCOUNT_CODE
enumValues.description: Number of discount codes in the shop has reached its limit.

enumValues.name: SHOP_EXCEEDED_MAX_PRICE_RULES
enumValues.description: Number of discounts in the shop has reached its limit.

enumValues.name: END_DATE_BEFORE_START_DATE
enumValues.description: Discount end date must be after the start date.

enumValues.name: PRICE_RULE_PERCENTAGE_VALUE_OUTSIDE_RANGE
enumValues.description: Percentage value must be between 0 and -100.

enumValues.name: PREREQUISITE_SUBTOTAL_AND_QUANTITY_RANGE_BOTH_PRESENT
enumValues.description: Only one of minimum subtotal or minimum quantity condition can be defined.

enumValues.name: ALLOCATION_METHOD_MUST_BE_ACROSS_FOR_GIVEN_TARGET_SELECTION
enumValues.description: Allocation method must be "across" for the provided target selection.

enumValues.name: APPLIES_ON_NOTHING
enumValues.description: Discount must apply on either one time purchase or subscription items, or both.

enumValues.name: MULTIPLE_RECURRING_CYCLE_LIMIT_FOR_NON_SUBSCRIPTION_ITEMS
enumValues.description: Recurring cycle limit must be 1 when a discount does not apply on subscription items.

types.name: ProductStatus
types.description: The possible product statuses.

enumValues.name: ACTIVE
enumValues.description: The product is ready to sell and is available to customers on the online store, sales channels, and apps. By default, existing products are set to active.

enumValues.name: ARCHIVED
enumValues.description: The product is no longer being sold and isn't available to customers on sales channels and apps.

types.name: ProductVariantInput
types.description: Specifies a product variant to create or update.

inputFields.name: barcode
inputFields.description: The value of the barcode associated with the product.

inputFields.name: compareAtPrice
inputFields.description: The compare-at price of the variant.

inputFields.name: fulfillmentServiceId
inputFields.description: The ID of the fulfillment service associated with the variant.

inputFields.name: harmonizedSystemCode
inputFields.description: The Harmonized System Code (or HS Tariff Code) for the variant.

inputFields.name: id
inputFields.description: Specifies the product variant to update or create a new variant if absent.

inputFields.name: imageId
inputFields.description: The ID of the image that's associated with the variant.

inputFields.name: imageSrc
inputFields.description: The URL of an image to associate with the variant.  This field can only be used through mutations that create product images and must match one of the URLs being created on the product.

inputFields.name: mediaSrc
inputFields.description: The URL of the media to associate with the variant. This field can only be used in mutations that create media images and must match one of the URLs being created on the product. This field only accepts one value.

inputFields.name: inventoryManagement
inputFields.description:
The fulfillment service that tracks the number of items in stock for the product variant. If you track the inventory yourself using the admin, then set the value to `shopify`. Valid values: `shopify` or the handle of a fulfillment service that has inventory management enabled.
 This argument is deprecated: Use tracked attribute on `inventoryItem` instead.

inputFields.name: inventoryPolicy
inputFields.description: Whether customers are allowed to place an order for the product variant when it's out of stock.

inputFields.name: inventoryQuantities
inputFields.description: Create only field. The inventory quantities at each location where the variant is stocked.

inputFields.name: inventoryItem
inputFields.description: Inventory Item associated with the variant, used for unit cost.

inputFields.name: metafields
inputFields.description: Additional customizable information about the product variant.

inputFields.name: privateMetafields
inputFields.description: The private metafields to associated with this product.

inputFields.name: options
inputFields.description: The custom properties that a shop owner uses to define product variants.

inputFields.name: position
inputFields.description: The order of the product variant in the list of product variants. The first position in the list is 1.

inputFields.name: price
inputFields.description: The price of the variant.

inputFields.name: productId
inputFields.description: Create only required field. Specifies the product on which to create the variant.

inputFields.name: requiresShipping
inputFields.description: Whether the variant requires shipping.

inputFields.name: sku
inputFields.description: The SKU for the variant.

inputFields.name: taxable
inputFields.description: Whether the variant is taxable.

inputFields.name: title
inputFields.description: This argument is deprecated: Variant title is not a writable field; it is generated from the selected variant options.

inputFields.name: taxCode
inputFields.description: The tax code associated with the variant.

inputFields.name: weight
inputFields.description: The weight of the variant.

inputFields.name: weightUnit
inputFields.description: The unit of weight that's used to measure the variant.

types.name: ProductVariantInventoryManagement
types.description: The method of inventory tracking for a product variant.

enumValues.name: SHOPIFY
enumValues.description: Shopify tracks this product variant's inventory.

enumValues.name: NOT_MANAGED
enumValues.description: This product variant's inventory is not tracked.

enumValues.name: FULFILLMENT_SERVICE
enumValues.description: A third-party fulfillment service tracks this product variant's inventory.

types.name: ProductVariantInventoryPolicy
types.description: The inventory policy for a product variant controls whether customers can continue to buy the variant when it is out of stock. When the value is continue, customers are able to buy the variant when it's out of stock. When the value is deny, customers can't buy the variant when it's out of stock.

enumValues.name: DENY
enumValues.description: Stop selling a product variant when it is out of stock.

enumValues.name: CONTINUE
enumValues.description: Continue selling a product variant when it is out of stock.

fields.description: Returns the amount of a refunded duty in shop and presentment currencies.

types.name: RefundDutyRefundType

enumValues.name: PROPORTIONAL
enumValues.description: The duty is proportionally refunded based on the quantity of the refunded line item.

types.name: RefundInput
types.description: Specifies the fields to create a refund.

inputFields.name: currency
inputFields.description: The currency (in ISO format) that is used to refund the order. This must be the presentment currency (the currency used by the customer) and is a required field for orders where the currency and presentment currency differ.

inputFields.name: orderId
inputFields.description: Order ID for which the refund is created.

inputFields.name: note
inputFields.description: An optional note attached to a refund.

inputFields.name: notify
inputFields.description: Whether to send a refund notification to the customer.

inputFields.name: shipping
inputFields.description: Specifies how much of the shipping cost to refund.

inputFields.name: refundLineItems
inputFields.description: A list of line items to refund.

inputFields.name: refundDuties
inputFields.description: A list of duties to refund.

inputFields.name: transactions
inputFields.description: A list of transactions involved in the refund.

fields.name: totalTax

types.name: ResourceAlert
types.description:
Presents information or problems to merchants, with 1 or more actions that they can take.
They can optionally have a specific icon and be dismissed by merchants.

fields.name: actions
fields.description:
Buttons in the alert that link to related information.
For example, _View risk assessment_.

fields.name: content
fields.description: Details about the alert.

fields.name: dismissibleHandle
fields.description:
Unique identifier that appears when an alert is manually closed by the merchant.
Most alerts cannot be manually closed.

fields.name: icon
fields.description: Icon that displays with the alert.

fields.name: severity
fields.description: Indication of how important the alert is.

fields.name: title
fields.description: The name of the alert.

types.name: ResourceAlertAction
types.description: An action associated to a resource alert.

fields.name: primary
fields.description: Whether the action is primary or not.

fields.name: show
fields.description: Resource for the action to show.

fields.name: title
fields.description: Action title.

fields.name: url
fields.description: Action target URL.

types.name: ResourceAlertIcon
types.description: The available icons for resource alerts.

types.name: ResourceAlertSeverity
types.description: The possible severity levels for a resource alert.

enumValues.name: ERROR
enumValues.deprecationReason: `ERROR` severity is being deprecated in favour of `WARNING` or `CRITICAL` instead.

fields.name: quantityUsed
fields.description: Quantity used of the resource. If null the quantity used cannot be retrieved.

fields.name: value

Properties used by customers to select a product variant.
Products can have multiple options, like different sizes or colors.

fields.name: value

types.name: SellingPlan
types.description:
Represents how a product can be sold and purchased. Selling plans and associated records (selling plan groups
and policies) are deleted 48 hours after a merchant uninstalls their subscriptions app. We recommend backing
up these records if you need to restore them later.

For more information on selling plans, refer to
[*Creating and managing selling plans*](https://shopify.dev/tutorials/create-manage-selling-plans).

fields.name: billingPolicy
fields.description: Selling plan policy which describes the billing details.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The date and time when the selling plan was created.

fields.name: deliveryPolicy
fields.description: Selling plan policy which describes the delivery details.

fields.name: description
fields.description: Buyer facing string which describes the selling plan commitment.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Globally unique identifier.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Buyer facing string which describes the selling plan content.

fields.name: options
fields.description: The values of all options available on the selling plan. Selling plans are grouped together in Liquid when they are created by the same app, and have the same `selling_plan_group.name` and `selling_plan_group.options` values.

fields.name: position
fields.description: Relative position of the selling plan for display. A lower position will be displayed before a higher position.

fields.name: pricingPolicies
fields.description: Selling plan pricing details.

types.name: SellingPlanAnchor
types.description: Represents a selling plan policy anchor.

fields.name: day
fields.description:
The day of the anchor.

If `type` is WEEKDAY, then the value must be between 1-7. Shopify interprets
the days of the week according to ISO 8601, where 1 is Monday.

If `type` is not WEEKDAY, then the value must be between 1-31.

fields.name: month
fields.description:
The month of the anchor. If type is different than YEARDAY, this field must be null, otherwise it must be
between 1-12.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Represents the anchor type, it can be one one of WEEKDAY, MONTHDAY, YEARDAY.

types.name: SellingPlanAnchorInput
types.description: Specifies the input fields required to create or update a selling plan anchor.

inputFields.name: type
inputFields.description: Represents the anchor type, must be one of WEEKDAY, MONTHDAY, YEARDAY.

inputFields.name: day
inputFields.description:
The day of the anchor.

If `type` is WEEKDAY, then the value must be between 1-7. Shopify interprets
the days of the week according to ISO 8601, where 1 is Monday.

If `type` is not WEEKDAY, then the value must be between 1-31.

inputFields.name: month
inputFields.description:
The month of the anchor. If type is different than YEARDAY, this field must be null, otherwise it must be
between 1-12.

types.name: SellingPlanAnchorType
types.description: Represents the anchor type.

enumValues.name: WEEKDAY
enumValues.description: Which day of the week, between 1-7.

enumValues.name: MONTHDAY
enumValues.description: Which day of the month, between 1-31.

enumValues.name: YEARDAY
enumValues.description: Which days of the month and year, month between 1-12, and day between 1-31.

types.name: SellingPlanBillingPolicy
types.description:
Represents the billing frequency associated to the selling plan (for example, bill every week, or bill every
three months). The selling plan billing policy and associated records (selling plan groups, selling plans, pricing
policies, and delivery policy) are deleted 48 hours after a merchant uninstalls their subscriptions app.
We recommend backing up these records if you need to restore them later.

every other week). The selling plan delivery policy and associated records (selling plan groups, selling plans,

We recommend backing up these records if you need to restore them later.

enumValues.name: GREATER_THAN
enumValues.description: Input value should be greater than minimum allowed value.

enumValues.name: GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO
enumValues.description: Input value should be greater than or equal to minimum allowed value.

enumValues.name: LESS_THAN
enumValues.description: Input value should be less than maximum allowed value.

enumValues.name: LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO
enumValues.description: Input value should be less or equal to maximum allowed value.

enumValues.name: NOT_A_NUMBER
enumValues.description: Input value is not a number.

enumValues.name: SELLING_PLAN_COUNT_LOWER_BOUND
enumValues.description: Must include at least one selling plan.

enumValues.name: SELLING_PLAN_MAX_CYCLES_MUST_BE_GREATER_THAN_MIN_CYCLES
enumValues.description: Selling plan's billing policy max cycles must be greater than min cycles.

enumValues.name: SELLING_PLAN_BILLING_AND_DELIVERY_POLICY_ANCHORS_MUST_BE_EQUAL
enumValues.description: Selling plan's billing and delivery policies anchors must be equal.

enumValues.name: SELLING_PLAN_BILLING_CYCLE_MUST_BE_A_MULTIPLE_OF_DELIVERY_CYCLE
enumValues.description: Selling plan's billing cycle must be a multiple of delivery cycle.

enumValues.name: SELLING_PLAN_PRICING_POLICIES_MUST_CONTAIN_A_FIXED_PRICING_POLICY
enumValues.description: Selling plan's pricing policies must contain one fixed pricing policy.

enumValues.name: SELLING_PLAN_MISSING_OPTION2_LABEL_ON_PARENT_GROUP
enumValues.description: Cannot define option2 on this selling plan as there's no label on the parent selling plan group.

enumValues.name: SELLING_PLAN_MISSING_OPTION3_LABEL_ON_PARENT_GROUP
enumValues.description: Cannot define option3 on this selling plan as there's no label on the parent selling plan group.

enumValues.name: SELLING_PLAN_OPTION2_REQUIRED_AS_DEFINED_ON_PARENT_GROUP
enumValues.description: Selling plan's option2 is required because option2 exists.

enumValues.name: SELLING_PLAN_OPTION3_REQUIRED_AS_DEFINED_ON_PARENT_GROUP
enumValues.description: Selling plan's option3 is required because option3 exists.

enumValues.name: SELLING_PLAN_PRICING_POLICIES_LIMIT
enumValues.description: Selling plans can't have more than 2 pricing policies.

enumValues.name: GROUP_DOES_NOT_EXIST
enumValues.description: Selling plan group does not exist.

enumValues.name: GROUP_COULD_NOT_BE_DELETED
enumValues.description: Selling plan group could not be deleted.

enumValues.name: ERROR_ADDING_RESOURCE_TO_GROUP
enumValues.description: Could not add the resource to the selling plan group.

enumValues.name: PLAN_ID_MUST_BE_SPECIFIED_TO_UPDATE
enumValues.description: Selling plan ID must be specified to update.

enumValues.name: ONLY_NEED_ONE_PRICING_POLICY_TYPE
enumValues.description: Only one pricing policy type can be defined.

enumValues.name: ONLY_NEED_ONE_PRICING_POLICY_VALUE
enumValues.description: Only one pricing policy adjustment value type can be defined.

enumValues.name: PRICING_POLICY_ADJUSTMENT_VALUE_AND_TYPE_MUST_MATCH
enumValues.description: Pricing policy's adjustment value and adjustment type must match.

enumValues.name: SELLING_PLAN_DUPLICATE_NAME
enumValues.description: Cannot have multiple selling plans with the same name.

enumValues.name: SELLING_PLAN_DUPLICATE_OPTIONS
enumValues.description: Cannot have multiple selling plans with the same options.

inputFields.description: Relative value for display purposes of this plan. A lower position will be displayed before a higher one.

types.name: SellingPlanPricingPolicy

Represents the type of pricing associated to the selling plan (for example, a $10 or 20% discount that is set
for a limited period or that is fixed for the duration of the subscription). Selling plan pricing policies and
associated records (selling plan groups, selling plans, billing policy, and delivery policy) are deleted 48
hours after a merchant uninstalls their subscriptions app. We recommend backing up these records if you need
to restore them later.

types.name: SellingPlanRecurringDeliveryPolicy
types.description: Represents a recurring selling plan delivery policy.

fields.name: anchors
fields.description: Specific anchor dates upon which the delivery interval calculations should be made.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The date and time when the selling plan delivery policy was created.

fields.name: cutoff
fields.description: A buffer period for orders to be included in a cycle.

fields.name: intent
fields.description:
Specifies if the delivery policy is merchant or buyer-centric.
Buyer-centric delivery policies state the time when the buyer will receive the goods.
Merchant-centric delivery policies state the time when the fulfillment should be started.
Currently, only merchant-centric delivery policies are supported.

fields.name: interval
fields.description: The delivery frequency, it can be either: day, week, month or year.

fields.name: intervalCount
fields.description: The number of intervals between deliveries.

fields.name: preAnchorBehavior
fields.description: Fulfillment or delivery behavior of the first fulfillment when the order is placed before the anchor. The default value for this field is `ASAP`.

types.name: SellingPlanRecurringDeliveryPolicyInput
types.description: Specifies the input fields to create or update a recurring delivery policy.

inputFields.name: interval
inputFields.description: The delivery frequency, it can be either: day, week, month or year.

inputFields.name: intervalCount
inputFields.description: The number of intervals between deliveries.

inputFields.name: anchors
inputFields.description: Specific anchor dates upon which the delivery interval calculations should be made.

inputFields.name: cutoff
inputFields.description: A buffer period for orders to be included in a cycle.

inputFields.name: intent
inputFields.description: Intention of this delivery policy, it can be either: delivery or fulfillment.

inputFields.name: preAnchorBehavior
inputFields.description: The pre anchor behavior. It can be either: asap or next.

types.name: SellingPlanRecurringDeliveryPolicyIntent
types.description: Possible intentions of a Delivery Policy.

enumValues.name: FULFILLMENT_BEGIN
enumValues.description: A merchant-centric delivery policy. Mark this delivery policy to define when the merchant should start fulfillment.

types.name: SellingPlanRecurringDeliveryPolicyPreAnchorBehavior
types.description: Possible fulfillment or delivery behaviors of the first fulfillment when the orderis placed before the anchor.

enumValues.name: ASAP
enumValues.description: Orders placed can be fulfilled / delivered immediately. Orders placed inside a cutoff can be fulfilled / delivered at the next anchor.

enumValues.name: NEXT
enumValues.description: Orders placed can be fulfilled / delivered at the next anchor date. Ordersplaced inside a cutoff will skip the next anchor and can be fulfilled / delivered at the following anchor.

types.name: ShopifyPaymentsAccount

Balance and payout information for a
[Shopify Payments](https://help.shopify.com/manual/payments/shopify-payments/getting-paid-with-shopify-payments)
account. Balance includes all balances for the currencies supported by the shop.
You can also query for a list of payouts, where each payout includes the corresponding currencyCode field.

fields.name: balance
fields.description: Current balances in all currencies for the account.

fields.name: bankAccounts

types.name: ShopifyPaymentsDisputeReason
types.description: The reason for the dispute provided by the cardholder's bank.

enumValues.name: FRAUDULENT
enumValues.description: The cardholder claims that they didn’t authorize the payment.

enumValues.name: GENERAL
enumValues.description: The dispute is uncategorized, so you should contact the customer for additional details to find out why the payment was disputed.

enumValues.name: UNRECOGNIZED
enumValues.description: The customer doesn’t recognize the payment appearing on their card statement.

enumValues.name: DUPLICATE
enumValues.description: The customer claims they were charged multiple times for the same product or service.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION_CANCELLED
enumValues.description: The customer claims that you continued to charge them after a subscription was canceled.

enumValues.name: PRODUCT_UNACCEPTABLE
enumValues.description: The product or service was received but was defective, damaged, or not as described.

enumValues.name: PRODUCT_NOT_RECEIVED
enumValues.description: The customer claims they did not receive the products or services purchased.

enumValues.name: CREDIT_NOT_PROCESSED
enumValues.description: The customer claims that the purchased product was returned or the transaction was otherwise canceled, but you have not yet provided a refund or credit.

enumValues.name: INCORRECT_ACCOUNT_DETAILS
enumValues.description: The customer account associated with the purchase is incorrect.

enumValues.name: INSUFFICIENT_FUNDS
enumValues.description: The customer's bank account has insufficient funds.

enumValues.name: BANK_CANNOT_PROCESS
enumValues.description: The customer's bank cannot process the charge.

enumValues.name: DEBIT_NOT_AUTHORIZED
enumValues.description: The customer's bank cannot proceed with the debit since it has not been authorized.

enumValues.name: CUSTOMER_INITIATED
enumValues.description: The customer initiated the dispute, so you should contact the customer for additional details to find out why the payment was disputed.

types.name: ShopifyPaymentsDisputeReasonDetails
types.description: Details regarding a dispute reason.

fields.name: reason
fields.description: The reason for the dispute provided by the cardholder's banks.

types.name: ShopifyPaymentsPayoutInterval
types.description: The interval at which payouts are sent to the connected bank account.

enumValues.name: WEEKLY
enumValues.description: Each week, on the day of week specified by weeklyAnchor.

enumValues.name: MONTHLY
enumValues.description: Each month, on the day of month specified by monthlyAnchor.

enumValues.name: MANUAL
enumValues.description: Payouts will not be automatically made.

types.name: ShopifyPaymentsPayoutSchedule
types.description: The payment schedule for a payments account.

fields.name: interval
fields.description: The interval at which payouts are sent to the connected bank account.

fields.name: monthlyAnchor
fields.description:
The day of the month funds will be paid out.

The value can be any day of the month from the 1st to the 31st.
If the payment interval is set to monthly, this value will be used.
Payouts scheduled between 29-31st of the month are sent on the last day of shorter months.

fields.name: weeklyAnchor
fields.description:
The day of the week funds will be paid out.

The value can be any weekday from Monday to Friday.
If the payment interval is set to weekly, this value will be used.

types.name: ShopifyPaymentsPayoutStatus
types.description: The transfer status of the payout.

enumValues.name: SCHEDULED
enumValues.description:
The payout has been created and had transactions assigned to it, but
it has not yet been submitted to the bank.

enumValues.name: IN_TRANSIT
enumValues.description: The payout has been submitted to the bank.

enumValues.name: PAID
enumValues.description: The payout has been successfully deposited into the bank.

enumValues.name: FAILED
enumValues.description: The payout has been declined by the bank.

enumValues.name: CANCELED
enumValues.description: The payout has been canceled by Shopify.

Example value: `"Z2lkOi8vc2hvcGlmeS9Qcm9kdWN0LzEwMDc5Nzg1MTAw"`.

types.name: SubscriptionBillingAttemptErrorCode
types.description:
The possible error codes associated with making billing attempts. The error codes supplement the
`error_message` to provide consistent results and help with dunning management.

enumValues.name: INVALID_PAYMENT_METHOD
enumValues.description: Payment method is invalid. Please update or create a new payment method.

enumValues.name: UNEXPECTED_ERROR
enumValues.description: There was an unexpected error during the billing attempt.

enumValues.name: PAYMENT_METHOD_DECLINED
enumValues.description: Payment method was declined by processor.

enumValues.name: AUTHENTICATION_ERROR
enumValues.description: There was an error during the authentication.

enumValues.name: TEST_MODE
enumValues.description: Gateway is in test mode and attempted to bill a live payment method.

types.name: SubscriptionDeliveryMethodInput
types.description:
Specifies delivery method fields for a subscription draft.
This is an input union: one, and only one, field can be provided.
The field provided will determine which delivery method is to be used.

Note: Only `shipping` is supported for now, but other inputs will be
added as they become supported in subscriptions.

types.name: SubscriptionDraftErrorCode
types.description: Possible error codes that could be returned by SubscriptionDraftUserError.

enumValues.name: ALREADY_REMOVED
enumValues.description: This line has already been removed.

enumValues.name: COMMITTED
enumValues.description: Subscription draft has been already committed.

enumValues.name: NOT_AN_INTEGER
enumValues.description: The value is not an integer.

enumValues.name: SELLING_PLAN_MAX_CYCLES_MUST_BE_GREATER_THAN_MIN_CYCLES
enumValues.description: The maximum number of cycles must be greater than the minimum.

enumValues.name: DELIVERY_MUST_BE_MULTIPLE_OF_BILLING
enumValues.description: The delivery policy interval must be a multiple of the billing policy interval.

enumValues.name: INVALID_LINES
enumValues.description: Must have at least one line.

enumValues.name: NO_ENTITLED_LINES
enumValues.description: Discount must have at least one entitled line.

enumValues.name: CUSTOMER_MISMATCH
enumValues.description: The payment method customer must be the same as the contract customer.

enumValues.name: DELIVERY_METHOD_REQUIRED
enumValues.description: The delivery method can't be blank if any lines require shipping.

enumValues.name: CYCLE_DISCOUNTS_UNIQUE_AFTER_CYCLE
enumValues.description: The after cycle attribute must be unique between cycle discounts.

enumValues.name: INVALID_ADJUSTMENT_TYPE
enumValues.description: The adjustment value must the same type as the adjustment type.

enumValues.name: INVALID_ADJUSTMENT_VALUE
enumValues.description: The adjustment value must be either fixed_value or percentage.

enumValues.name: STALE_CONTRACT
enumValues.description: Another operation updated the contract concurrently as the commit was in progress.

enumValues.name: GREATER_THAN
enumValues.description: Input value should be greater than minimum allowed value.

enumValues.name: GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO
enumValues.description: Input value should be greater than or equal to minimum allowed value.

enumValues.name: LESS_THAN
enumValues.description: Input value should be less than maximum allowed value.

enumValues.name: LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO
enumValues.description: Input value should be less or equal to maximum allowed value.

fields.name: sellingPlanId
fields.description:
The selling plan ID associated to the line.

Indicates which selling plan was used to create this
contract line initially. The selling plan ID is also used to
find the associated delivery profile.

The subscription contract, subscription line, or selling plan might have
changed. As a result, the selling plan's attributes might not
match the information on the contract.

fields.name: sellingPlanName
fields.description:
The selling plan name associated to the line. This name describes
the order line items created from this subscription line
for both merchants and customers.

The value can be different from the selling plan's name, because both
the selling plan's name and the subscription line's selling_plan_name
attribute can be updated independently.
